channel.title: Cannot run a .bat file
channel.description:
ok, i downloaded several different sources, but when ever i go to open the dos screen or .batch file, it says
Another program is currently using this file.
BEFORE REPLYING:
my old server isnt running, cant connects
i have already tried restarting my computer, it didnt work.
thanks if you can help me

item.title: Cannot run a .bat file
item.dc:creator: @r0bin_h0od r0bin h0od
item.description:
@r0bin_h0od wrote:

how i get to system processes, is it though contol panel?[br][size=1]Posted on: May 21, 2007, 04:58:39 PM[/size][hr]bee buuu bumpaeya!!![br][size=1]Posted on: May 21, 2007, 05:01:59 PM[/size][hr]no, nothing is a .bat file in my system. already checked it out, wtf is going on, i think my computer just sucks.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot run a .bat file
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“r0bin h0od, post:1, topic:98372”]ok, i downloaded several different sources, but when ever i go to open the dos screen or .batch file, it says

Another program is currently using this file.

BEFORE REPLYING:

my old server isnt running, cant connects

i have already tried restarting my computer, it didnt work.

thanks if you can help me[/quote]

Go into system processes and close any MS-DOS related processes. For your server make sure you’re using Hamachi or No-IP.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot run a .bat file
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

Right click runserver.bat or whatever, click edit. It should look SOMETHING like this:

@echo off title Server "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_06\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1024m server pause
Change the 1.5.0_06 to your jre version [It can be found by clicking on start, then clicking RUN, and put this into the box:

"C:\Program Files\Java\" and see what JRE versions you have there.
Do the same with JDK. (compile.bat)

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot run a .bat file
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

In “edit” on right click did you change the JDK/JRE version to yours?

Read full topic
